qas.question: In multiple countries in Europe students can attend a university with what kind if financial burden?
Until what year were public universities in nordic nation free of tuition?
What kind of students pay fees in public universities in Denmark?
In terms of Universities in Denmark what is the fee status for citizens of EFA states?
What happened to public grants in nordic universities that continued to allow foreign students?
Until what year were public universities in the UK free of tuition?
What kind of students pay fees in public universities in the UK?
What happened to public grants in nordic universities that continued to allow domestic students?
What three countries moved to put in place tuition fees for domestic students?

plausible_answers.text: the amounts of public grants granted to promising foreign students

qas.question: What were decreased to offset some of the impact?

context: There are several major exceptions on tuition fees. In many European countries, it is possible to study <a0_0>without tuition fees<a0_0/>. Public universities in Nordic countries were entirely without tuition fees until <a1_0><b5_0>around 2005<b5_0/><a1_0/>. <b8_0>Denmark, Sweden and Finland<b8_0/> then moved to put in place tuition fees for <a2_0><b6_0>foreign students<b6_0/><a2_0/>. Citizens of EU and EEA member states and citizens from Switzerland remain <a3_0>exempted from tuition fees<a3_0/>, and <b9_0>the amounts of public grants granted to promising foreign students<b9_0/> were <a4_0><b7_0>increased<b7_0/><a4_0/> to offset some of the impact.
